title.narrative: Responding to the Child Protection needs of girls and boys affected by the IDPs crisis in the ongoing conflict.

description.narrative: The goal of the project is to provide support for children under humanitarian situation access child protection services. Aiming to cover the children and families within the IDPs’ community and the host community. The HfH project is in line with UNICEF Country Program Plan and Iraq Humanitarian Response Plan “Objective 1: Provide immediate protection support to highly at-risk populations, including to people in difficult-to-reach and unstable environments”. “Providing immediate referral services for at-risk girls and boys, particularly unaccompanied and separated children”. “Providing emergency case management for survivors of gender-based violence, distributing dignity kits, and referring, as appropriate, cases for additional medical care”. “Providing psychological first aid and psycho-education for vulnerable individuals”. HfH will provide the best efforts and utilize all experience and lessons learnt to implement the designed results and achieve the required impact. HfH will count on the vision of providing better protection environment for children reflects peace and prosperity in community. This goes along with the urgent situation IDPs currently are experience. The intervention to address the immediate protection needs at this stage will enable the community of IDPs to be stabilized and developed. The total number of beneficiaries that the project will target is 10.300 direct and indirect IDPs mainly children and their families, service provider and hoist community. HfH has strong communication system with ministries in Baghdad like MoLSA and MoDM in addition to the strong relationship with related governmental departments like DoLSA, Woman care department in addition to the local authorities in Salah Al Din provincial council, district councils and local councils. The HfH staff in Salah Al-Din were working in the humanitarian field from long time and HfH is relaying on them in this regard. Through working with communities, HfH gain good level of community respect and can access all areas in Mosul. The HfH will reflect all gained experience to reach the organization vision and UNICEF goal.
